sentence.Network_en: The dinner was often a riotous affair enlivened by superbly witty speeches.
sentence.Network_cn: 宴会常常会因为一些非常诙谐的讲话而气氛活跃，热闹非凡。

sentence.Network_en: The organizers of the march were charged with assault and riotous assembly .
sentence.Network_cn: 游行组织者被控侵犯人身及暴乱性非法集会。

sentence.Network_en: He has been sent down for riotous behaviour.
sentence.Network_cn: 他因为行为放纵而被开除了.

list.abs: we spent a riotous night at christmas ., 圣诞节我们度过了一个狂欢之夜.
He was expelled from college for riotous conduct ., 他因行为放荡而被勒令退学.
we spent a riotous night at christmas ., 圣诞节我们度过了一个狂欢之夜.
your riotous color , your fragrance , your taste ., 你放纵的色彩 , 你的香气和味道.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'troublesome'): from Old French, from riote (see riot)

entry.def: If you say that someone has a riotous lifestyle, you mean that they frequently behave in a excessive and uncontrolled way, for example by eating or drinking too much.

example.ex: ...aristocrats who wasted their inheritances in riotous living.
example.tran: 在放纵的生活中将遗产挥霍一空的贵族

entry.tran: (行为或事件)狂欢的，喧闹的，放纵的
entry.def: You can describe someone's behaviour or an event as riotous when it is noisy and lively in a rather wild way.

example.ex: The dinner was often a riotous affair enlivened by superbly witty speeches.
example.tran: 宴会常常会因为一些非常诙谐的讲话而气氛活跃，热闹非凡。

example.ex: ...a riotous exhibition of boogie-woogie piano playing.
example.tran: 欢闹的布吉乐钢琴演奏会

entry.tran: 色彩丰富的;五颜六色的;装饰华丽的
entry.def: You can describe things as riotous when they are very colourful or decorative rather than plain or simple.

example.ex: ...a riotous collection of gaudy and glamorous dresses.
example.tran: 各种各样花哨而华丽的服装

means.word_mean: 1. produced or growing in extreme abundance;
2. characterized by unrest or disorder or insubordination;

sentences.sentence: "effects of the struggle will be violent and disruptive"

Sentence.sentence: But the message that everyone must screen for cancer has become so deep-rooted that when health care experts recommended that women under 50 and over 74 stop screening for breast cancer, it caused a riotous reaction among doctors, patients and advocacy groups.

means.word_mean: 狂暴的,狂乱的,暴乱的,不受约束的
